data.title: How to watch San Francisco Giants vs. Washington Nationals
data.meta_description: Blake Snell takes on Jake Irvin as the Giants play the third of this four-game road series against the Nationals this afternoon.
data.text:
The San Francisco Giants continue this four-game road series against the Washington Nationals this afternoon from the nation’s capital.

Taking the mound for the Giants will be left-hander Blake Snell, who enters today’s game with a 4.29 ERA, 3.10 FIP, with 72 strikeouts to 24 walks in 56.2 innings pitched. If you don’t remember Snell’s last start, in the Giants’ 3-0 win over the Cincinnati Reds on Friday, you might be living under a rock. It was not only Snell’s first complete game shutout, but also his first no-hitter. He allowed just three walks with 11 strikeouts in nine innings.

He’ll be facing off against Nationals right-hander Jake Irvin, who enters today’s game with a 3.56 ERA, 3.89 FIP, with 115 strikeouts to 32 walks in 134 innings pitched. His last start was in the Nationals’ 8-3 loss to the Milwaukee Brewers on Friday, in which he allowed four runs on six hits with four strikeouts and two walks in five and two thirds innings.

Game #116

Who: San Francisco Giants (57-58) vs. Washington Nationals (52-62)

Where: Nationals Park, Washington D.C.

When: 3:45 p.m. PT

Regional broadcast: NBC Sports Bay Area (available on fuboTV)

National broadcast: n/a
